TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataPagerCommandEventArgs extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the event of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> object raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField.PagerCommand> event when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageButton> control that is inside the pager field is clicked. These buttons are child controls that can be defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField.PagerTemplate%2A> template of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> field.
During the event, you can perform tasks such as changing the number of rows that will be displayed or changing the index of the first item on the page.
For more information about how to handle events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs> class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs> object to enable the user to specify which page of data will be displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs> object is passed to the handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField.PagerCommand> event of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> class.
> [!IMPORTANT] > This example contains a text box that accepts user input, which is a potential security threat. By default, ASP.NET Web pages validate that user input does not include script or HTML elements. For more information, see [Script Exploits Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/772c7312-211a-4eb3-8d6e-eec0aa1dcc07).
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs/CS/DataPagerCommandEventArgsCS.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs/VB/DataPagerCommandEventArgsVB.aspx#1)]

Docs.param: The object that contains the command button that was clicked.
The command name and command argument of the button that was clicked.
The object that contains the object and its container object.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs> class.
> [!NOTE] > This constructor is primarily used by control developers when raising events.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs> class
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.PagerField%2A>|The value of the `pagerField` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.TotalRowCount%2A>|The value of the `totalRowCount` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.Item%2A>|The value of the `item` parameter.|

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Item As DataPagerFieldItem

Docs.summary: Gets the object that contains the object and the object's container object.
Docs.value: The object that contains the object and the object's container object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object, which is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem> object returned by this property, contains the button that was clicked. Alternatively, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.PagerField%2A> property to retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.Item%2A> property to retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> control that is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> object. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs/CS/DataPagerCommandEventArgsCS.aspx#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs/VB/DataPagerCommandEventArgsVB.aspx#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of records to display on each page of data.
Docs.value: The maximum number of records to display on each page of data. The default is -1, which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you set a value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.NewStartRowIndex%2A> property, you must also set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.NewMaximumRows%2A> property. If you do not want to change the current value, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.NewMaximumRows%2A> property to the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.MaximumRows%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control. You can access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.Item%2A> property.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.NewMaximumRows%2A> property to set the maximum number of records to display on each page of data. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs/CS/DataPagerCommandEventArgsCS.aspx#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs/VB/DataPagerCommandEventArgsVB.aspx#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the index of the first record to display on a page of data.
Docs.value: The index of the first record that will be displayed on a page of data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You usually set this property to change the page number that is currently being displayed.
When you set a value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.NewStartRowIndex%2A> property, you must also set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.NewMaximumRows%2A> property.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.NewStartRowIndex%2A> property to set the index of the first record to display in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control. The record to display is based on the page number that is specified by the user. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs/CS/DataPagerCommandEventArgsCS.aspx#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs/VB/DataPagerCommandEventArgsVB.aspx#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets the total number of records to display.
Docs.value: The total number of records to display.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.TotalRowCount%2A> property to retrieve the total number of records in the associated data source.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs.TotalRowCount%2A> property to check whether the user requested an item that does not exist in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs/CS/DataPagerCommandEventArgsCS.aspx#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerCommandEventArgs/VB/DataPagerCommandEventArgsVB.aspx#2)]
